properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 11 at 7:54PM EST until January 11 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a

* Tornado Warning for...
Central Hart County in northeastern Georgia...
Central Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina...

* Until 830 PM EST.

* At 753 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located 5 miles west of Hartwell, or near Bowersville, moving
northeast at 55 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed.
Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree
damage is likely.

* This dangerous storm will be near...
Reed Creek around 800 PM EST.
Anderson, Northlake, Anderson Airport and Homeland Park around 820
PM EST.

Other locations impacted by this dangerous thunderstorm include
Townville, Sandy Springs and Sadlers Creek State Park.
properties.instruction:
A brief, weak tornado is likely. Mobile homes could be flipped.
Falling trees can cause death or serious injury, and major damage to
houses. Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of
a sturdy building.

Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National
Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800,
2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using
hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the
specific location where it occurred.

CMAMtext: NWS: TORNADO WARNING in this area til 8:30 PM EST. Take shelter now. Check media.
